overview_summary: None of these three adjacent landowners have an openly documented position on development projects, making their stances unknown. All appear to be private residents with no evident public roles, suggesting a generally low level of community influence.

neighbors.name: Steven E. Currier
neighbors.claims: Steven E. Currier is identified as a Caldwell County landowner (parcel #52-5), but there are no public reports of him serving in any county boards or speaking at local meetings ([caldwellcounty.ky.gov](https://caldwellcounty.ky.gov/departments/fiscal-court/Pages/fiscal-court-minutes.aspx#:~:text=Download%20,Court%20Minutes%20October%2024%2C%202023)). No mentions of Currier were found in available local media or records, indicating he maintains a low public profile ([caldwellcounty.ky.gov](https://caldwellcounty.ky.gov/departments/fiscal-court/Pages/fiscal-court-minutes.aspx#:~:text=Fiscal%20Court%20Minutes%20February%2027%2C,2024)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a neighborly, low-key introduction and listen to any concerns he may have, emphasizing respect for his property and privacy.

neighbors.name: Michael S. Wasielewski
neighbors.claims: Michael S. Wasielewski owns parcel #52-4 in Caldwell County, Kentucky ([caldwellcounty.ky.gov](https://caldwellcounty.ky.gov/elected-officials/Pages/property-valuation-administrator.aspx#:~:text=The%20mission%20of%20the%20Caldwell,so%20that%20the%20statutes%20of)). There is no record of Wasielewski participating in local government or media coverage in Caldwell County, suggesting he keeps a very low public profile ([www.wkdzradio.com](https://www.wkdzradio.com/2020/09/08/caldwell-county-reporting-three-new-covid-19-cases/news-edge/#:~:text=Caldwell%20County%20Reporting%20Four%20New,through%2090th%20cases%20since%20the)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage one-on-one in a respectful manner, perhaps through a mutual acquaintance or community event, to build trust and understand his perspective quietly.

neighbors.name: James Carver Bell
neighbors.claims: James Carver Bell was the owner of parcel #52-9 in Caldwell County ([www.lakelandchapel.com](https://www.lakelandchapel.com/obituaries/James-Carver-Bell?obId=1102870#:~:text=James%20Carver%20Bell%20Obituary)). A local funeral home obituary for Bell was posted in Princeton, indicating he is deceased ([www.lakelandchapel.com](https://www.lakelandchapel.com/obituaries/James-Carver-Bell?obId=1102870#:~:text=James%20Carver%20Bell%20Obituary)). There is no evidence that Bell ever made any public statements about development prior to his passing ([caldwellcounty.ky.gov](https://caldwellcounty.ky.gov/departments/fiscal-court/Pages/fiscal-court-minutes.aspx#:~:text=Fiscal%20Court%20Minutes%20December%2028%2C,Court%20Minutes%20October%2024%2C%202023)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with his estate or surviving family, approaching with condolences and sensitivity. Any engagement should respect the family’s privacy and focus on understanding any legacy concerns for the property.
